Lancer, thanks for the contribution.

Several years ago, Prof. Stephanie Fo=
rrest at the University of New
Mexico told me about a class assignment she =
had given in which her
students evolved FSMs with their own NEAT implementa=
tions.  The
results were apparently mixed, with some seeming to work and so=
me not
working at all.  However, she had not required the students to
imple=
ment speciation because of time constraints in the semester, so
these were =
NEAT implementations without species.  Based on that fact
that some seemed =
to work okay anyway, I'd guess that with a full
implementation of NEAT, it =
might work pretty well.

Of course, there are some new issues that come up.=
  For example, each
node has a different identity.  Also, maybe more intere=
sting, it is
not clear what topology should begin evolution in the initial
=
population (or if perhaps the initial population should contain a
variety o=
f simple topologies).

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "lancersolurus" <g=
aming@...> wrote:
>
> I uploaded a version of Mat's NEAT program that will =
compile under 
> Visual Studio 2005. All I did was fix in-loop variable cre=
ations (a no-
> no from 2005 onward) and adjust some of the internal settin=
gs. Enjoy...
> 
> A question, has anyone attempted to mix NEAT with a FSM?
=
> 
> Lancer Solurus
>
